Reviews.Title: “Surprising Stairs - Fab Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: KatySpinach
Reviews.Content: When my friends and I arrived at PC Hooft Hotel we were rather impressed at its location (it's on a rather plush street near the museums/galleries). However, we were not prepared at all for the very steep staircase which seemed to go on and on. Luckily we were only there for a few nights so we only had little cases to drag up the stairs! The room I stayed in had a small window which I kept permanently open due to the room STINKING of cigarettes! I sprayed alot of my perfume to mask the odour. There was a communal shower which wasn't too clean. The positive side was the staff were friendly and 'laid-back' (well this is Amsterdam if you know what I mean). The breakfast was very good, we helped ourselves to a mighty amount it too! My recommendation is that this is a very niche Hotel, in other words if you a) have Back Problems/Disabilities b) are put off by smoke smells c) are older than 30 then this hotel IS NOT FOR YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Do. Not. Stay. at. This. Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. We arrived and were shown to a basement room (after being told there were "no other rooms available at all" by the less than understanding receptionist) with no window, with maintenance work being loudly carried out in the hallway outside. After complaning, we were miraculoulsy given a top floor room. Had this suddenly become available within the last, literally, 180 seconds? The television was in an awful condition, no ironing board was supplied as we had been told and the room had no air-con. We were next to 2 very inconsiderate travellers, who, due to the thin and ultra NON soundproof walls, kept us awake till at least 4am each and every night. Breakfast was OK, but very basic and in a horrible surrounding. The Vondelpark entrance at the end of the street was fenced off and all in all, my opinion of Amsterdam has been soured by this truly horrific hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were first shown to a room with no window, so luckily we got changed to a room with a window. The small double rooms are very small, ensuite was clean and recently retiled. Breakfast was good. Very expensive and not a 3 star std hotel. The area was nice and not very far from shops and leidsplein. We paid 546 for 4 nites.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: mariamargarita
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel room for an extra night in Amsterdam and our much cheaper one star up the street was totally booked, so we booked this hotel on Expedia. While it was very nice to have our own bathroom, it was absolutely not worth the money. The bed was pretty uncomfortable, the TV was black & white and the elevator smelled terrible. Considering I was able to priceline a 4 star hotel room for substiantally less in another major european city, I really feel that the Hotel Pc was kind of a rip off. Amsterdam is an expensive city to stay in, but with a little work, you could defenitely do better. I should also note that this hotel has a different name on the front, it is called the Hotel City Gardens, not Hotel PC. However, the address matches, so it ended up working out.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: go here if you dont mind crackheads and homeless people on your 2 hour walk from the city to your hotel ,dutch elvis(the owner)is a decent enough guy whose hotel reeks of puff

Reviews.Title: “Horible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The PC Hotel in Amsterdam is an overpriced, small, dank and dingy place that's out in the middle of nowhere. The PC Hotel has horrible business practices, just horrible. There are many places to stay in Amsterdam, dont waste any money on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights in this hotel, and I cancelled after I arrived and had a look at the hotel and room, paying 65 Euros as a penalty. The location of this hotel is in fact, quite close to the museums and to the more chic shopping area. However, this hotel, or motel rather, needs a major renovation. The lift was in bad repair, and the carpeting worn through, even at the lobby. The rooms were, to be kind, fairly rundown as well. The beds and sheets looked clean, though. The receptionist was polite, and professional. If you are looking for a purely budget hotel, this could be the place for you. But between this and Ibis-chain of hotels is a whole world of difference (huge tip towards Ibis). I finally ended up paying just 20 Euros more for a room at Novotel Amsterdam. I would seriously discourage you from staying at this hotel if you're on a romantic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...after all :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, the thing is we (and "we" being my girlfriend and I) spent a night in a not ventilated dorm, so the fact that we finally found a double room, due to a "tall ship something", adds a lot to my grade of this, after all pleasent place. It's situated in the street of the same name, PC Hooft, which is the most exclusive shoping place in Amsterdam. The guy who works there gave us a triple bed room for the two of us, so it was a nice start. for the price of 26 Euros per person, we got bed&breakfast-not much of it, but for a shorter stay, it will get you through the morning. Well, the worst thing is THEY HAVE MICE!!! So just don't keep your food in your room, and it will be OK. All the best! And the stairs are a sight of their own kind, but not a big problem...

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Clean 1 Star hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous Hotel. The location is great, in a quieter part of town. Totally within walking to Muesums, restaurants and town. Although it is serviced by tram too for those who hate walking! The staff are friendly and the rooms very clean. The Breakfast is rolls, eggs, ham, cheese and coffee/tea and all for Â£50 - Â£65 (depending if you want your own bathroom or not. For a 1 star hotel you can't get better!!! Definately recommend this place -----

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommened for location and cheap price (50 euro double)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The PC Hooft had a great location - right by Vondel park and a 5 minute walk from the Leidsplien. Its a one star hotel and there is not elevator and most of the rooms share a bathroom. This might seem like a problem for many Americans who are used to Ramada style accomodations but it is not bad at all. There were separate toilets for men and women and two shower rooms shared between 8 or so rooms on our floor. The bathrooms were clean and I never had to wait for the other guests during my five night stay. Each room had its own sink. The rooms were small but comfortable enough. I don't think the rooms were air conditioned but I am not sure as we were there in April it wasn't necessary. Breakfast is included - it is served until 11 am and included hard boiled eggs, ham & cheese, coffee, tea juice and rolls with jam. All in all my brother and I were very happy with the service and rooms at a cost of 50 Euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a friendly place! I have stayed at this hotel three times on my numeorus visits to Amsterdam and have always left wanting to come back. In a superb location just outside the city by the Vondelpark and Rijksmuseum but with excellent walking access to all of the city centre attractions this is far and away one of the better budget options. Ok, the rooms are not luxury and sharing a shower and toilet is a drag but here it is a lot better than many other options. It is also a lovely traditional Dutch building on the most swanky street in Holland! And if your going to complain about climbing stairs while in Amsterdam your obviously a really fun person who knows how to have a good time! Its all part of the experience and if you do get a room on the top floor you should consider yourselves lucky for the free yet breathtaking views of the city. And I have always found the breakfast to be just fine.

HotelInfo.Name: PC Hooft Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: PC Hooftstraat 63 | Museum Quarter, Amsterdam 1071 BN, The Netherlands
